comments.body: It's inevitable for players to reach kill the Warden to get the Monsters Hunted(kill every mob) Advancement though.
It feels like more of a hidden advancement to me, to be honest, but yeah unless they change the Mobs Hunted advancement, players will always have to kill it once. Which is kinda counter-intuitive.
at least we get a achievement
Very interesting idea!
The warden is very hard to beat. If he dieshe should drop a very good item. Maybe a sculk sword that allows you to see entities trough walls if they make noise.
maybe "headstand" gotten by naming a warden grumm or dinnerbone.

Looks like there's some good news for you: the warden currently spawns in the experimental Bedrock Beta, but it doesn't attack the player. It just runs to where they are and screams at them. Once the warden gets to where the player is, it appears it just stays there, screaming, even after the player walks away. I'm guessing that's to avoid players constantly being chased by a screaming warden since that wouldn't be very fun either.

I can see where you're coming from with the idea of a "safe mode", but what else would you change? I'm not a fan of changing Peaceful Mode substantially since that's the main way I play. I like gathering, exploring, and building. I don't mind being scared, otherwise I wouldn't go anywhere near lava. I just don't like fighting at all and have no desire to fight mobs ever.

Edit: And of course the day after I submit this comment, they release a snapshot that stops the Warden from spawning in peaceful lol

The warden still should spawn and try to kill the player in peaceful mode but just does less damage. I feel like that's more balanced for the loot the ancient city gives. like it does 6 hearts on peaceful mode (2 hearts for ranged)

ONLY if it's spawn through the shreikers. it would attack the player.
personally, no. i go into peaceful in a deep dark because i am terrified of that thing, whether it’s gonna kill me or not.
Yes please because i created a microsoft account and I have no way of getting a cape.

This would defeat the point of the cape, which is for those people who have been playing Minecraft since before the migration, meaning if you created your account during or after it, you really didn't earn the cape. Capes are meant to be hard to get, and the migrator's cape will b no exception (or, at least, it will be in a few years...)

• give migration cape
  •
It's supposed to look like that so it doesn't stand out
It stands out more because of its yucky texture.

That’s exactly what I came here to post! The glow lichen texture doesn’t match its light level. It should look more bioluminescent, at least in some places. I think it would look nice with a dim glow overall but with some brighter spots where the lichen is thicker looking.

Now, with the new deep dark caves recently, the glow lichen REALLY stands out against the grimstone, and not in a good way. It could really use a textural touch-up, because as of right now, it looks like it could fit perfectly with the programmer art textures (which I kind of hope that it actually is as of now, though I doubt it).
I think tweaking the texture while also making it transparent would be a good idea.
would be nice if it was like that glow berry stuff
The amethyst's sounds are part of what makes it unique. I think keeping the other gems and ores the way they are is smart

I like this idea, but I think it should be the first ore that drops in clumps however it still has to be smelted. I think it should drop about 3-4 chunks and then you smelt them in a furnace for a shorter timer per chunk. Normally smelting/cooking something would take 8 seconds, but I think it should take 6-7 seconds in a normal furnace and in a blast furnace that would be 2-3 seconds. This would decrease the amount of time waiting for the small chunks to smelt while still having to wait awhile for all the chunks to smelt.
i like this idea but it is very possible peoples issues with copper rarity will be solved by the final generation
i also think they should have like copper bars similar to iron bars so we can have thin copper fencing
Zainur
no
also leaf litter isn't a plant. its waste from plant parts that fell on the ground. therefore it should be able to be on any block because it's just leaves.
I agree it's already annoying when this happens with grass
This!!! Please!

This is what I'm saying, and I agree. It's not going to solve any balancing issues, it's only going to make balancing worse. Especially since swamps can be 1000s of blocks away, and diamonds are not renewable. This is not a good change overall, especially not for multiplayer.
This should be added in 1.19 snowy taiga will get use if villages and pillager outposts generate in this biome by making in them house

I agree with the vast majority of what you say, but the Warden only kills you with one hit if you have no armor or armor less than Netherite (I don't know if with diamond armor the Warden can kill you in one hit), and the Warden's melee and ranged damage is the same. :)

Even though I like the idea of the Warden wall phasing, it would just make escaping the Warden even more difficult because it would always follow unless you had a clear escape. Climbing blocks should definitely be a feature though since it looks like the Warden is incredibly strong. Also it wouldn't make sense if the Warden used it all the time because it would prevent the Warden from getting closer to the player.
The main use for them other than building is probably putting them in a compostor for bone meal, which is pretty decent, but yeah could be nice to have more use to them.
I was surprised to see that they can't be crafted into sticks.

I don't know because I find it very funny when a warden is running after bats. Maybe not make them spawn naturally so this happens less often as it breaks the scary mood but I would not make them scared since as I said before it's still funny to see a warden run after bats.
I mean it is funny but also detracts from the whole Scary Monster Of Death That Follows You vibe
Want this change so deeply. It is even now already so annoying the warden not despawning because of the bats
yo no puedo oír la música ya que no estoy en java si no en bedrock pero la música es relajante
The songs are really good and better but they're really kind of loud

The new lena raine music is too loud compared to c418 music. In some cases you have to turn down the volume for the game audio to be audible. However in doing so, you’re left with the original tracks being too quiet or hard to hear. There needs to be an adjustment.

I hope mojang aren't sour about C418’s music. I don’t hate the new music though the caliber of music by C418 far outclasses the new music and it is a real shame they play so quietly compared to the new music. I really want the inverse if anything. I wouldn’t complain if c418 was louder compared to the rest of the music. RESTORE THE VOLUME OF C418’S MUSIC MOJANG.
I agree that they are too hazardous, but this could be alleviated by having frequent connective blocks between both sides so you won't fall down far; or making sure there is water at the bottom.

Tbh I don't really know what the crack carvers are supposed to add that ravines don't... they're just seem more common and less pretty.

", or only place them in snow/ice biomes as crevasses naturally form in icy areas." I like the idea of crack carvers being more common/unique to certain biomes. Plains biomes don't really look like plains with lines dug up everywhere.

I also believe the cracks are a little much at the moment. When I am exploring the world, especially for the first time, it really kills my immersion as a player because I can't look at the horizon any more, at least not while moving. I have played for a little while on the recent snapshots and even with full diamond I still find myself instantly dying from time to time when I was walking around and did not check the ground.

My suggestion would be to expand the footprint of the individual cracks horizontally by a few blocks to give them a "bank" effect much like the rivers, so that the player has a bit of a warning without having to live in fear. Also they feel too frequent, maybe some biome specific modifiers like suggested previously?

Other than this though I have absolutely loved where the game is headed. Personally I hope to see more uses for copper and amethyst.

Agreed. Crevasses are quite much, especially considering the dimension they reside in, often being even more dangerous than the Nether and End's terrain. I would suggest that they should be removed, but ravines should be made more common between level 0 and level 32, that way we can still light up the noise caves without having death traps scattered throughout the Overworld. Ravines are way more noticeable and much less dangerous anyway.
I think the idea of making the cracks have a bit of y level gradation on the surface is a perfect solution!
I think this should be an enchant instead and the higher the level the bigger the picking up area gets.

i think that would cause confusion as to where items have gone even if the player knew about the feature they would have to search possibly multiple bundles whenever they pick up an item. i agree that it could make a good enchant.
Or if we could enchant the minecarts with Depth strider.

Mojang are quite famous for not listening to their community. Hate to see that this is a major change, for them to just come out and say oh we are doing this and mostly don't care about your opinion on it.

In my opinion the new system is really bad because you won't be able to remember update numbers.
Right now I exactly know that 1.12 was world of color, 1.13 was update aquatic, 1.14 was Village and Pillage, and so on. It's one simple easy big number which is recognizable and increases by one at a time.
With the new system, I wont be remembering if a drop has been the third or the fourth update in 2026 or if it maybe even came out in 2027.
It probably also will be very confusing to new players as well, as it's not really intuitive.
The only reason mojang changed this is so that players would not notice that updates are not small. Because right now, players are noticing that the big number is not increasing. Bad change.

I agree completely! I also think that thinks like walls, stairs, fences, and slabs should be bigger and fit the shelves better like they do on bedrock. I had hoped to make intricate designs, but I was disappointed when I realized that it would not look good on java like it does on bedrock.

While wildflowers have already been added to 1.21.5 of Java Edition and 1.21.70 of Bedrock Edition as of typing this, I'd love to see this eventually become a thing, as I think wildflowers are far nicer for fields of flowers than the flowers themselves, but are lacking in variety of color.

Maybe make a crafting recipe with a missing space in the center, 1 block tall flowers of your choosing in the corners (minus wildflowers themselves), and wildflowers in the last 4 spaces, giving you 4 wildflowers with the specifications you made while crafting. The flowers you use replace the yellow ones on the wildflowers (with dandelions just basically being the same as they are right now) in their respective quadrants of the 1x1 space they're placed on.

Considering there are several other blocks, items, and entities that also have a plethora of purely aesthetic variations, such as armor with armor trims, banners and their various patterns, or leather armor and their ability to be dyed to more than just the basic 16 colors, I don't think this would be particularly difficult to make happen, and for me personally, would make wildflowers one of the most fun decoration-focused items in the game.
plis vote my idia
It'd be useful to have a sawmill (stonecutter but for wood) workstation for this.
You have no idea how many times I have tried to bonemeal dirt to make grass block.

Maybe instead of bonemeal it should be the seeds you get from breaking grass.

I  think that would make a little more sense.
Minecraft is New en 1.18.1
Minecraft new 100,000 1.0.1

That would be awesome! But It would be tricky because people would get mad when the babies don't drop a name tag. In the end, unless they do some confusing stuff with the slime, the name tag would not be able to be retrieved once put on a slime if you think about it. Unless they decide to OP slimes which I think would be dum :/

 

I do think that this is a cool idea tho, and I would love to see it in game. But it is debatable if it is a good feature to add ya know.
